intro: Badula grammisticta, commonly known as the Grammisticta badula, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The botanical features of Badula grammisticta make it an attractive addition to shaded garden settings.
